meanings.definition: Confirm the truth or accuracy of something.
meanings.sent1: I need to verify if the answer is correct.
meanings.sent2: Please verify your identity before entering the building.
meanings.sent3: The detective had to verify the alibi of the suspect.
meanings.sent5: The scientist used a special tool to verify the experiment results.

meanings.definition: Prove to be true or accurate.
meanings.sent1: He will verify his theory with more evidence.
meanings.sent2: The fingerprints on the weapon verified his guilt.
meanings.sent3: The magic potion verified its effectiveness by turning the frog into a prince.
meanings.sent4: The old map verified the existence of hidden treasure.
meanings.sent5: The witness's testimony verified the suspect's alibi.

meanings.definition: Demonstrate the truth or accuracy of something.
meanings.sent1: The experiment will verify the hypothesis.
meanings.sent2: The data will verify the scientist's claims.
meanings.sent3: The talking parrot verified its intelligence by solving puzzles.
meanings.sent4: The rainbow verified the passing rain shower.
meanings.sent5: The certificate will verify your completion of the course.
